result.title: Think math for 599-D. Spongebob and Squares
result.content:
• initially to get number of squares in n*m grid suppose n<m
  • we will get summation of n*m + (n-1)*(m-1) + (n-2)*(m-2) + ... + (n-n+1)*(m-n+1)
  • Assume that x equal this equation such that x is number of squares in this grid
  • after get proof of this equation as figure below http://codeforces.com/predownloaded/15/61/1561034828bdc3d9534fa464981428e01a34abdf.png
  • we will loop about n term and get m term then add this pair and it's opposite in set (n,m),(m,n)
  • solution will be print size of set and all pairs in this set.
  • solution will be like that : http://codeforces.com/contest/599/submission/18956083
